title: Why does everyone go up in their arms when an AD assassin becomes meta?

replies.body: Because Assassin's tend to only be fun for the person playing the assassin, getting 1 shot with no counter-play feels unfair, and while it might look good in the LCS, it's just not fun in the game in general.

I think it's more accurate to say assassin metas are only exciting for assassins. For instance counterjungling and being counterjungled and trying to setup vision for a surprise assassination or ambush for a counter gank is exceptionally fun for assassin players, playing around with bushes and try to out juke your opponent or escape and then predict where you can circle round and get revenge is very entertaining. Being oneshot isn't especially fun, but it becomes alot more exciting when both players can 1shot the other, and so it becomes a game of patience and reaction speed, and a shaco and khazix playing a game of hide and seek in the jungle is alot more exciting and interactive than being malzahar ulted.

On the other hand in say the assassin vs adc matchup, it's still kind of fun for the assassin, trying to find a way to sneak in, burst the adc and leg it before their team notices, but for the adc it's not especially interactive since alot of the peel and defense they have is focused on the support and tanks, and not being ambushed relies alot on the team setting up proper vision control. 

Still this is how the matchup is supposed to be, and it would be like complaining that knights are too good at forking and slipping through defensive pawn formations in chess. Assassins have strengths and weaknesses, and since they offer nothing to a traditional teamcomp, their role is to assassinate the backline and pick off enemies out of position.
Well i mean, they are only fun for an ahead assassin, put 2 assassin's against each other, and watch the one behind hate being an assassin, because they can't even 1-shot the ADC.

Because Assassins are a pain to deal with and require coordination to stop which is lacking in solo que.

Assassins when strong 1 shot ADC and Supps and burst tanks so low they have to leave fights instantly making them useless. Strong assassins are not fun to play against. The fact that almost every assassin also has really good escape tools after jumping in makes them even less so.
Kayn has a shit escape and so does talon, either they need to blow their escapes to get in, or they lose 1/2 of their damage if they dont
Clearly you did not master these two champs.

How do they lose damage if they don't blow their escapes to get in? You saying that Kayn and Talon's E's do damage? Also talon can jump over one wall, then run and jump over another to get out. Not really "blowing all his escapes" when he has them all around him.

what i meant by damage was talons ult, because his flips are easy to prevent, any slow stuffs them, and they are usually used to enter, where they cant be used to escape for 2 min, and kayn cant get into fights easily unless he uses e, which he then cant use to escape, he is either easy to kite or keep at a distance in red or so squishy can kill him before gets close as blue, only a super fed kayn can get into a teamfight (against non idiots) without using an escape, be it flash or e. And kayn usually uses his e to engage ganks anyway, no more escape, same with talon, he flips over wall to initiate but doesn't flip back out, gets his burst then runs away in many scenarios without a reliable escape, because even if he does use r, he loses the invis if his w is still in flight, as the returning w removes his stealth
You still didn't explain how talon not able to flip **another** wall after finishing his job.

botlane or toplane ganks usually end up with him flipping the wall in then cant flip out, and mid lane, as soon as he appears, any form of cc stuffs him and makes flips useless as it either cancels them and puts it on cd, prevents them or makes the flip so slow you can slap him to death as rakan. And in the chaos of the jungle and the thickness of the walls, it isnt uncommon for his flips to either go nowhere or just flip him a few mm to the side, effectively cancelling his flip.
Maybe, just maybe, you should try to practise more with his E? It has much longer range than flash - if you can flash through walls why wouldn't you E through walls?
maybe just maybe you dont understand what slows and cc do to his flips
Slows and CC affect MOST champs.  It is not a problem that ONLY talon has to deal with.

but they don't have their escapes reduced to nothing by slows, shen akali trist khazix the whole lot don't have their dashes or jumps affected by slows, the only champs who are are talon and yasuo. Ever tried jumping a wall as talon with a nasus slow or something on you? And flips and stuff will destory him when flipping because he is registered in that spot he initally flipped from until he lands, so if he is even 0.01 seconds from landing and a singed, hecarim or vayne e hits him he is sent right back to the start, same with hard cc like stuns, snares or silences. And the e sometimes bugs and flips backwards anyway, into the enemies. 

And doing a quick search on it this came up, of btw none of the issues and bugs he mentioned were ever fixed in the patchnote bugs

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/p5x3isj4-for-the-love-of-godnerf-lethality-all-u-want-but-fix-talons-bugs-and-spells-lack-of-coordination

For me it is because a full ad comp is easy to defend against and by choosing an ad mid you are having an impact on the preferences of the rest of the team given that mid is "typically " where the magic damage comes from.
